If you say: If preachers were to abandon preaching except upon attaining this degree, then the world would be devoid of preaching and hearts would be ruined? I say: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said, "Love of the world (Dunya) is the head of every sin." And if people did not love the world, the world would perish, livelihoods would cease, and hearts and bodies would all be destroyed. So he did not abandon advising and mentioning the danger in love of the world, nor did he abandon mentioning it out of fear that he would leave himself to the destructive desires that Allah has empowered over His servants to drive them with them to Hellfire, in confirmation of His saying, the Most High: "But the word from Me has become true: I will fill Hell with jinn and mankind all together." Likewise, the tongues of preachers remain unleashed for love of leadership, and they do not abandon it due to the saying of one who says: Preaching for love of leadership is forbidden, just as the creation does not abandon drinking, fornication, theft, hypocrisy, oppression, and other sins due to the saying of Allah, the Most High, and His Messenger that it is forbidden. So look to your own self (Nafs) and be empty-hearted (Qalb) from the talk of people, for Allah, the Most High, reforms many creation through the corruption of one person and persons: "And if Allah did not repel some people by others, the earth would be corrupted." And Allah supports this religion with people who have no share (in the Hereafter). What is feared is that the path of taking admonition is corrupted. As for silencing the tongues of preachers while behind them is the motive of leadership and love of the world, that will never be.

And it is said regarding His statement, the Exalted: 'So no soul (Nafs) knows what has been hidden for them of delight of the eyes as reward for what they used to do' (Quran 32:17), it is said their action was fasting because He said: 'Indeed, the patient ones will be given their reward without account' (Quran 39:10). So the reward for the fasting person is poured out completely and given generously, not entering under imagination and estimation, and it is worthy to be so because fasting is specifically for Him and honored in relation to Him, even though all acts of worship are for Him, just as the House is honored in relation to Himself and all the earth is His, for two meanings: The first is that fasting is restraint (Kaf) and abandonment (Tark), and it is in itself a secret (Sirr) with no visible action, and all acts of obedience are witnessed and seen by creation, but fasting is not seen except by Allah, the Exalted, for it is an action in the inner (Batin) with pure patience (Sabr). The second is that it subdues the enemy of Allah, the Exalted, for the means of Satan, may Allah curse him, are the desires (Shahawat), and desires are strengthened by eating and drinking, and therefore the Prophet, peace be upon him, said: 'Indeed, Satan flows in the son of Adam like blood, so constrict his pathways with hunger.' And therefore the Prophet, peace be upon him, said to Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her: 'Persist in knocking on the door of Paradise.' She said: 'With what?' a.g: Then is one who was a believer like one who was defiantly disobedient? They are not equal.
As for those who believed and did righteous deeds, for them will be the Gardens of Refuge as accommodation for what they used to do.

But as for those who defiantly disobeyed, their refuge is the Fire. Every time they wish to emerge from it, they will be returned to it while it is said to them, "Taste the punishment of the Fire which you used to deny."

ğŸ“– Vol 4: Patience and Gratitude
And Allah the Exalted has described the patient ones with attributes and mentioned patience in the Quran in over seventy places, and He attributed most degrees and goodnesses to patience and made them its fruit, as He the Mighty and Majestic said: 'And We made from among them leaders guiding by Our command when they were patient' (Quran 32:24), and He the Exalted said: 'And the good word of your Lord was fulfilled upon the Children of Israel because they were patient' (Quran 7:137), and He the Exalted said: 'And We will surely give those who were patient their reward by the best of what they used to do' (Quran 16:96), and He the Exalted said: 'Those will be given their reward twice for what they were patient' (Quran 28:54), and He the Exalted said: 'Indeed, the patient ones will be given their reward without account' (Quran 39:10). So there is no act of worship except that its reward is by measure and account except patience, and because fasting is from patience and it is half of patience, Allah the Exalted said: 'Fasting is for Me and I will reward it' (Hadith), so He attributed it to Himself from among all other acts of worship, and He promised the patient ones that He is with them, as He the Exalted said: 'And be patient, indeed Allah is with the patient ones' (Quran 8:46), and He made victory conditional upon patience, as He the Exalted said: 'Yes, if you are patient and fear (Allah) and they come upon you in this heat, your Lord will reinforce you with five thousand angels having marks' (Quran 3:125), and He gathered for the patient ones between matters He did not gather for others, as He the Exalted said: 'Those are upon them prayers from their Lord and mercy, and those are the guided ones' (Quran 2:157). So guidance, mercy, and prayers are gathered for the patient ones, and enumerating all the verses in the station of patience would be lengthy.

And they say, "When will be this conquest, if you should be truthful?"
Say, [O Muhammad], "On the Day of Conquest the belief of those who had disbelieved will not benefit them, nor will they be reprieved."
